newsitem.title: BELGIUM: SOCCER SHOWCASE-KEY ANDERLECHT PAIR SET FOR FINAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-KEY ANDERLECHT PAIR SET FOR FINAL.

text.p: Bosnian Suad Katana and Ghanaian international Yaw Preko were pronounced fit on Friday and ready to play for Anderlecht in Sunday's Belgian Cup final against Ekeren.

Katana, who suffered a thigh injury earlier this week, was badly needed to shore up Anderlecht's defence against in-form Ekeren, scorers of 21 goals in their last five league games -- all of them victories.

The recovery of Preko, who received a calf injury playing for Ghana in a World Cup qualifier against Gabon last month, also sparked a sigh of relief at Anderlecht, whose main striker Gilles De Bilde left in mid-season.
Six other regulars nursing injuries earlier this week, including goalkeeper Geert De Vlieger, were also available, team doctor Raymond Edelman said.
Bosnian midfielder Cvijan Milosevic and Hungarian defender Ervin Kovacs had resumed normal training at Ekeren.
Milosevic had been out for a week with a groin problem and Kovacs was sidelined with a calf injury for three weeks.
Ekeren only miss suspended defender Nick Descamps.
